item.value: China has the largest population of any country. It has over 1.3 billion people.
The closest planet to earth is Venus. It is about 38 million kilometers away. It would take over 4 years to travel there by plane.
On July 20, 1969, Neil Armstrong became the first human to step on the moon.
The moon orbits the Earth every 27.32 days
The tallest woman was Zeng Jinlian. She was 2.48 meters ( 8ft 2in ) tall.
Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered, sustained, and controlled flight of an airplane.on the morning of December 17, 1903. In 1919 the First transatlantic flight was made.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
In 1783 Jean Pilatre de Rozier ( a Frenchman ) made the first balloon flight, reaching a peak altitude of about 500 ft, and traveling about 51/2 mi in 20 min.
The original Olympic Games were a series of athletic competitions held in Ancient Greece.
There are more than 2,700 languages in the world. There are also more than 7,000 dialects. A dialect is a regional language variation with different pronunciation, vocabulary, or meaning.
The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean in the world. It covers about 1/3 of its surface.
The tallest building in America is the Willius Tower in Chicago.
The blue whale can produce the loudest sound of any living animal. The sound can be detected as far away as 530 miles.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.
The blue whale is the largest known animal on Earth. The second largest animal is the Afican elephant.

On 12 April 1961 Yuri Alekseyevich Gagarin, a Soviet cosmonaut , became the first human in outer space and the first to orbit the Earth. He became a hero of the Soviet Union for his pioneering tour in space.
The longest river is the Nile. It is 6,650 Km ( 4,132 miles ) long. It flows into the Mediterranean Sea.
A sneeze generates a wind of 166 km/hr (100 mi/hr), and a cough moves out at 100 km/hr (60 mi/hr).
By 2008 there were almost 1.3 billion telephone lines in the world.
The Universe is about 14 billion years old. The earth is young in comparison, it is only 4.6 billion years old.
